definition: properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip

sentences.english: A man should not want to carve out his meat to an ounce before-hand.
sentences.chinese: 一個人也不宜要求事前把一切安排得妥妥貼貼。

sentences.english: The Swiss Foreign Office has handled this very smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士外交部非常妥貼地處理了這件事。

sentences.english: Is it cause she's not treating you right?
sentences.chinese: 是由於她沒法妥貼的對待你嗎？

sentences.english: Pleottom let me know if this is suitstaying consideredble.
sentences.chinese: 請讓我知道這能否妥貼。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to have a fluent command of (idiom)
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
